summary: This document consists of two FBI email exchanges from July 2019 regarding coordination for victim services and interviews related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails discuss scheduling interviews with victims in Florida and the availability of victim specialists.

persons.name: M.S.C.J.
persons.context: Victim Specialist for the FBI's Miami Headquarters and Homestead Resident Agency, listed as the point of contact for victim services in the email signature.

events.title: Scheduled victim interviews
events.description: FBI agents scheduled interviews with potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein at 11 AM and 3 PM.

events.title: Case agent travel to Florida
events.description: An FBI case agent was reported to be traveling to Florida to conduct interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: FBI was actively coordinating victim interviews in Florida in July 2019 as part of the Epstein investigation.
Victim specialists were being mobilized to provide services to potential victims who requested them.
The emails demonstrate inter-office FBI coordination between New York (NY), Miami (MM), and possibly other divisions (DO) regarding victim outreach.
The communication emphasizes confidentiality and protection of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) as per the Electronic Communication Privacy Act.
